replies.bodyText: Updated. Left restUser and password since not necessary if you're not using REST api but the rest are needed for importer to get data flowing
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: Primitives can't be null. Min(0) would be appropriate though
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to provide build args if you just want to run the image. Those args are only for build stage which happens manually via mvn.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,57 @@
+package com.hedera.mirror.importer.parser.performance;
+
+/*-
+ * ‌
+ * Hedera Mirror Node
+ * ​
+ * Copyright (C) 2019 - 2020 Hedera Hashgraph, LLC

+ * limitations under the License.
+ * ‍

+
+import org.testcontainers.containers.GenericContainer;
+import org.testcontainers.containers.wait.strategy.Wait;
+import org.testcontainers.images.builder.ImageFromDockerfile;
+
+public class CustomPostgresContainer {
+    public static ImageFromDockerfile createSeededDockerImage(String dockerFilePath, String pgDumpFile) {
+        return new ImageFromDockerfile()
+                .withFileFromClasspath("Dockerfile", dockerFilePath)
+                .withFileFromClasspath("bucket-download-key.json", "data/bucket-download-key.json")
+                .withFileFromClasspath("postgresql.conf", "data/postgresql.conf")
+                .withBuildArg("dumpfile", pgDumpFile)

replies.bodyText: Removed as image build logic was removed
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: Why are we duplicating and performance testing REST queries in the importer module? If the queries change in REST API we now have to change it here. We already have performance tests for the REST API in the REST API module. We should later figure out how to use the restore client to populate the data for the tests there. Recommend these be removed.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
This was a suggestive test method for use so we could answer questions like "If we changed a in the db how are customer REST API calls affected"
Removing though as I agree with the respecting module boundaries and the extra maintenance concern
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Gotcha. Will apply the suggestion to the table size checks as the above checks that every table has rows. Not every table at restore will have rows. Also the original intent was just to check all expected tables were created.
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: It's still using JDBC, which was my main complaint. I don't think you need to check if all these tables exist. Just check that one table exists and has data via count() along with the container exit code check should be sufficient.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText:
This test can't work in CircleCI as it doesn't support Docker in Docker. In fact, in CircleCI it looks like it runs but finds no tests to execute:
 2020-06-04 20:42:33,184 INFO  [main ] c.h.m.i.p.p.RestoreClientIntegrationTest Started RestoreClientIntegrationTest in 11.512 seconds (JVM running for 14.805)
 2020-06-04 20:42:33,228 INFO  [task-1] c.h.m.i.p.b.BalanceFileParser Skip watching directory: ./data/accountBalances/valid
 2020-06-04 20:42:33,282 INFO  [task-2] c.h.m.i.p.r.EntityIdCacheLoader Cached 0 entity id mappings in 60.23 ms
 2020-06-04 20:42:33,289 INFO  [main ] c.h.m.i.p.p.RestoreClientIntegrationTest Stop container null
 [INFO] Tests run: 0, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 12.939 s - in com.hedera.mirror.importer.parser.****ormance.RestoreClientIntegrationTest
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Changing the Tag so it's not run as part of tests
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we need to verify table size separately from checkSeededTablesArePresent(). Can combine
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Should not use JUnit 4.x features. I doubt this is even working as you are manually creating object and starting and stopping. JUnit 5.x recommended approach is to use @TestContainers + @Container.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
It works, I looked at your recommended approach earlier but went the Manual Lifecycle Control way since I needed to pull in the DbPorperties which is non static.
The shared container approach requires a static container declaration.
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText:
I don't see the need for this class.
a) It's no longer creating a postgres container, so it's named wrong.
b) Has 3 public methods but only one actually used publically
c) There is a PerformanceIntegrationTest where this logic makes more sense
d) The static strings make it harder to read, not easier. They're not needed for performance or reuse reasons so better to inline.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Sounds good will merge into PerformanceIntegrationTest
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: We can't create images in CircleCI currently. It would be better if we just pushed some golden images (100k, 1M, 10M) for use in these tests manually instead of building each time.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.message:
Addressed feedback, reduced footprint

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

Removed REST api related tests calls

timeline.bodyText: These are absolutely necessary to be not blank even if you're not using the REST API. This is because they run as part of Flyway migration and will fail if empty.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Gotcha. Will make change in next PR
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: Should be protected and non-static. Can just inject DBProperties into this class and use it without having to pass it via parameter.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to assertThat(customContainer.getContainerInfo().getState().getExitCodeLong()).isEqualTo(0L);? Or does TestContainers automatically do that?
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: In combination with the Wait logic I believe this is covered but I can verify.
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: It checks for us as expected using the One Shot. startup strategy.
replies.author: Nana-EC
